revised_title: Genetic Analysis of Rogue Phenotypes in Culinary Peas
tldr: The authors studied the genetics of "rogue" plants in culinary peas, which have distinct pointed leaflets and upward-curving pods. They found that these plants have a unique genetic property where type characters are excluded from the germ-lineage. The authors also discovered that the proportion of non-pointed and pointed plants in the offspring depends on the position of the seeds on the parent plant.
